meanings.sent1: The dog woofed loudly when the mailman approached.
meanings.sent2: The puppy woofed happily when its owner returned home.
meanings.sent3: The dog woofed loudly, scaring away the pesky squirrel.
meanings.sent4: The old hound woofed like a seasoned guard dog, alerting everyone of the visitor.
meanings.sent5: The neighborhood echoed with the sound of dogs woofing in excitement.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, the dog woofed at the passing car.
meanings.sent2: The dog woofed at the sound of thunder last night.
meanings.sent3: The dog woofed and then wagged its tail happily.
meanings.sent4: The dog woofed once, then fell silent in anticipation.
meanings.sent5: The dog woofed softly, almost as if whispering to its owner.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, rough noise
meanings.sent1: The engine woofed as the car struggled up the steep hill.
meanings.sent2: The wind woofed through the trees on the stormy night.
meanings.sent3: The old door woofed in protest as it was opened after years of neglect.
meanings.sent4: The bear woofed in the distance, signaling its presence in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm woofed angrily, shaking the windows with its power.
